meanings.definition: To loosen or undo the laces of (a shoe or garment)
meanings.sent1: She carefully unlaces her sneakers before entering the house.
meanings.sent2: He always unlaces his boots after a long day of work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to unlace all the shoes in the hallway.
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, she unlaces the corset of tradition that constrained her.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved un lacing a shoe and making it float in mid-air.

meanings.definition: To remove or untie laces from (something)
meanings.sent1: The child unlaces the ribbon from the gift box with excitement.
meanings.sent2: She carefully unlaces the bow from her hair, letting her curls fall free.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to unlace the bird feeder, causing a seed shower.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the sky seems to unlace the colors of the day.
meanings.sent5: The wind unlaces the sails of the ship, propelling it forward with ease.

meanings.sent1: He struggles to unlace the knot in his shoelaces after a long run.
meanings.sent2: She quickly unlaces the tangled necklace, freeing the pendant.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seems to unlace the hammock every time someone tries to relax.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the music seems to unlace the tension in the room, bringing peace.
meanings.sent5: The gentle touch of the breeze unlaces the petals of the flower, revealing its beauty.
